What is brain-to-brain communication? How does brain-to-brain communication work?

The brain-to-brain interface detects motor imagery in EEG signals recorded from one subject (the “sender”) and transmits this information over the internet to the motor cortex region of a second subject (the “receiver”).
Brain-to-brain communication occurs with: Is brain-to-brain communication possible without sensory channels? Brain-to-brain communication scientific evidence

Recently, direct brain-to-brain communication (DBBC) outside the conventional five senses has been verified between animals and humans. Nevertheless, no empirical studies or serious discussion have been performed to elucidate the mechanism behind this process.
Is brain-to-brain communication possible without sensory channels? Brain-to-brain communication scientific evidence

Our results show that information extracted from one brain using EEG can be transmitted to another brain using TMS, ultimately allowing two humans to cooperatively perform a task using only a direct brain-to-brain interface (BBI) as a channel of communication.
